medical_history.chief_complaint: Late-onset agranulocytosis after 19 years of clozapine monotherapy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began initially in 1990 with acute psychosis and were managed with clozapine. In February 2007, his white blood cell (WBC) count decreased to 3.7 310^9/L, then suddenly decreased to 2.5 310^9/L in February 2009, followed by further decrease to 1.9 310^9/L in April 2009, coinciding with the onset of laryngitis and high fever. After discontinuation of clozapine, his WBC count increased to 3.5 310^9/L within a week and stabilized at 5.9 310^9/L by May 2011.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Paranoid schizophrenia diagnosed in 1990, opium abuse.
medical_history.social_history: Substance dependence on heroin, used intravenously.
